about: Civil Engineering is a branch of engineering that focuses on the planning, design, construction, and maintenance of infrastructure. It integrates elements of structural, geotechnical, environmental, transportation, and water resources engineering to develop safe and sustainable built environments. Civil engineers work on various projects, including bridges, roads, buildings, dams, and urban planning, ensuring durability, efficiency, and safety. With rapid advancements in construction materials and technology, the field is evolving towards smart infrastructure, incorporating sustainable and resilient designs to address climate challenges. As the demand for modern and eco-friendly cities increases, civil engineering continues to drive innovation in infrastructure, enhancing functionality, sustainability, and societal impact.
vision: To become a center of excellence to meet the global challenges in the diversified field of Civil Engineering.
mission: To impart quality Education through effective teaching learning methods.
To encourage students to pursue research activities and to collaborate with industries to promote consultancy activities.
To develop engineers who can participate in the technical advancement and social upliftment of the society.
objective: The objective of Civil Engineering Department is to disseminate the knowledge above latest technologies in Civil Engineering to the students so that they cater the demand of builders/contractors and construction industry in and around the institution as well as to the needs of the country and abroad.
peo: Analyse, design and execute projects based on the fundamental knowledge of Civil Engineering.
Implement feasible solution to overcome societal problems using professional knowledge which results in sustainability.
Exhibit professional and ethical attitude, good communication skills and pursue life-long learning skills needed for a successful professional career.
po: Engineering knowledge: Apply the knowledge of mathematics, science, engineering fundamentals, and an engineering specialization to the solution of complex engineering problems.

Problem analysis: Identify, formulate, review research literature, and analyze complex engineering problems reaching substantiated conclusions using first principles of mathematics, natural sciences and engineering sciences.

Design/development of solutions: Design solutions for complex engineering problems and design system components or processes that meet the specified needs with appropriate consideration for the public health and safety, and the cultural, societal, and environmental considerations.

Conduct investigations of complex problems: Use research-based knowledge and research methods including design of experiments, analysis and interpretation of data, and synthesis of the information to provide valid conclusions.

Modern tool usage: Create, select, and apply appropriate techniques, resources, and modern engineering and IT tools including prediction and modeling to complex engineering activities with an understanding of the limitations.

The engineer and society: Apply reasoning informed by the contextual knowledge to assess societal, health, safety, legal and cultural issues and the consequent responsibilities relevant to the professional engineering practice.

Environment and sustainability: Understand the impact of the professional engineering solutions in societal and environmental contexts, and demonstrate the knowledge of, and need for sustainable development.
Ethics: Apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics and responsibilities and norms of the engineering practice.
Individual and team work: Function effectively as an individual, and as a member or leader in diverse teams, and in multidisciplinary settings.

Communication: Communicate effectively on complex engineering activities with the engineering community and with society at large, such as, being able to comprehend and write effective reports and design documentation, make effective presentations, and give and receive clear instructions.

Project management and finance: Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the engineering and management principles and apply these to one’s own work, as a member and leader in a team, to manage projects and in multidisciplinary environments.
Life-long learning: Recognize the need for, and have the preparation and ability to engage in independent and life-long learning in the broadest context of technological change.
pso: Understand the requirement of the industry and perform effectively with professional skills.
Apply advanced and innovative techniques and methodologies in Civil Engineering Practices.

detail: Strength of Materials Laboratory was established in the year 1984, focused on demonstrating the basic principles in the area of strength and mechanics of materials and structural analysis to the undergraduate students through a series of experiments is the objective of the strength of materials lab.
The following material properties of Steel Rods, Wires, Wood, Paver Block, Tiles, Bricks, Hollow Blocks, Hume Pipes can be determined in the laboratory:
- Digital Rockwell and Brinell Hardness Test
Consultancy and testing activities like Compression test, Tension test, Hardness test, and Bend test are done for Government and Non-governmental organizations.

The concrete laboratory is equipped with all the latest equipment for testing the quality of cement, fine aggregates, and coarse aggregates. Concrete strength tests and analysis are also carried out in this laboratory.
This laboratory is equipped with the following equipment:

The 'Mc Carty' Environmental Engineering Laboratory is well equipped with the latest equipment and testing facilities in the area of drinking water quality analysis, wastewater analysis, sludge analysis, salt contents in soil, etc.
- Magnetic Stirrer with Hot Plate 1 Lt
- Digital pH Meter & Digital Conductivity Meter
Testing and consultancy activities are carried out for various government agencies like the Public Works Department, TWAD Board, Highways Department, and also for various private agencies.

labs.topic: Khosla Hydraulic Engineering Lab-I & Visvesvaraya Engineering Lab-II
detail: The Hydraulics Laboratory, established at the inception of the Civil Engineering Department, consists of two labs: one for machinery and another for flow experiments.

The laboratory is fully equipped with all necessary equipment along with their accessories as required for courses in Civil, Mechanical, Mechatronics, and Electronics & Instrumentation Engineering. The laboratory has kept pace with modern technological advancements with the addition of new equipment as and when required.
- Underground tank capacity: 55,675 litres of water
- Two small sumps for (Pelton wheel turbine & Kaplan turbine) with re-circulation system in Laboratory I.
- Outside sump: To collect the water from the flow experiments.
* The Fluid Mechanics Laboratory (Lab-II) is equipped with:
- Ship Model for Determination of Meta-Centric Height and a Hydraulic Ram
* The Hydraulic Machinery Laboratory (Lab-I) is equipped with:

The laboratory building is provided with adequate ventilation, lighting, and comfortable seating arrangements for students to work. Routine repair and maintenance of all equipment are done by the lab technician with support from a service engineer from outside, who also takes care of annual servicing.

The Survey Laboratory is equipped with the latest survey equipment such as Total Station, Auto Level, and GPS. Consultancy services are offered in the field of land surveying, preparation of contour maps, setting out works, and partitioning of land properties in different districts of Tamil Nadu.
The survey camp is conducted for the benefit of students as part of their academic curriculum for four days during their winter vacation.

The Computer Centre in the Department of Civil Engineering was established in the year 1997 to provide knowledge on computer-based analysis, design, and drafting to students, as well as to facilitate research and consultancy activities.

John Pennycuick Computer Centre was established in February 2017. It provides a platform for students to enhance their knowledge in computer-based analysis, design, and drafting. The centre is also used for research and consultancy activities.
The Computer Centre is well-equipped and air-conditioned with the following facilities:
- 72 computers with the latest software packages
Additionally, the laboratory has adequate printing facilities and remains open for students beyond working hours.
The Soil Mechanics Laboratory, established in 1985, meets the requirements of the undergraduate program as well as research and consultancy activities.
- Infra-Red Moisture Meter with Auto Transformer
The Highway Engineering Laboratory is well equipped with the following equipment:
Consultancy and testing activities are carried out for government and non-governmental organizations.
The Structural Engineering Laboratory is well equipped with the following equipment:
- Power Pack (Motorized Pumping Unit) for Hydraulic Jack
Consultancy and testing activities on the behavior of beams, columns, beam-column joints, slabs, and RC frames can be investigated.
The Project Laboratory provides an environment for students to develop their projects and conduct scientific research, experiments, and measurements under controlled conditions.
